contextId.occurrenceNote: They were commanded to form the hammered cups so that they resembled flower blossoms. Alternate translation: "with hammered cups that resemble flower blossoms" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])

Aaron was to present the Levites to Yahweh with the same amount of dedication as if they were a sacrifice given to him. Alternate translation: "if they were a wave offering" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])

Aaron was to present the Levites to Yahweh as if he were lifting up an offering to Yahweh. Alternate translation: "dedicate them to me, as if you were lifting them up a wave offering to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: lift them up as a wave offering to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Aaron was to present the Levites to Yahweh as if they were a wave offering to him. Alternate translation: "You must dedicate them to me, as if you were presenting a wave offering to me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: You must offer them as a wave offering

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the cloud's appearance during the night. Here the cloud is compared to looking like a fire. Alternate translation: "During the night the cloud looked like a huge fire until morning" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: It appeared like fire until morning

contextId.occurrenceNote: The cloud's appearance is compared to a huge fire. Alternate translation: "it looked like a huge fire at night" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
Leprosy turned Miriam's skin white. Alternate translation: "became very white" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])

Miriam's leprosy would cause her body to decay until she died. The flesh being decayed is spoken of as if it were eaten. Alternate translation: "Please do not let her be like a dead newborn baby whose flesh is half decayed" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: Please do not let her be like a dead newborn whose flesh is half consumed

contextId.occurrenceNote: The men speak of grasshoppers to show how very small they thought themselves to be compared to the people of the land. Alternate translation: "we are as small as grasshoppers in comparison with them" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: we were like grasshoppers in comparison with them

contextId.occurrenceNote: Moses speaks as if the earth were alive and the opening in the ground into which these people would fall were a large mouth that would eat them. Alternate translation: "and they fall into it and are buried underneath the ground" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: the earth opens its mouth and swallows them

contextId.occurrenceNote: The way the Israelites will destroy their enemies is spoken of as if they were an ox eating up the grass in a field. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: This multitude will eat up all that is around us as an ox eats up the grass in a field

contextId.occurrenceNote: This simile says that Yahweh's great strength is equal to an ox. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: with strength like that of a wild ox

contextId.occurrenceNote: Balaam speaks of the Israelies as if they were numerous enough to cover entire valleys. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
Balaam speaks of the Israelies as if they were well-watered gardens that produce an abundant harvest. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
Cedar trees were the largest trees in Israel. Balaam speaks of the Israelies as if they grew as large as well-watered cedar trees. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
This simile emphasizes that the Israelites have great strength. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: with strength like a wild ox

contextId.occurrenceNote: In this simile, Balaam compares the Israelites to both male and female lions. This means they are dangerous and always ready to attack. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: He crouches down like a lion, like a lioness

contextId.occurrenceNote: This is a simile that means without a leader the people will wander and be helpless. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: so that your community is not like sheep that have no shepherd

contextId.occurrenceNote: Just like a small object in a person's eye or a small thorn that sticks into a person skin can cause great irritation, so even a small portion of the Canaanites, if left in the land, would cause great trouble for the Israelites. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-simile]])
contextId.glQuote: like objects in your eyes and thorns in your sides
